verses.verse: Then Zophar<WH6691> the Naamathite<WH5284> answered,<WH6030>
"Shall a multitude<WH7230> of words<WH1697> go<WH6030> unanswered,<WH3808> <WH6030> And a talkative<WH8193> man<WH376> be acquitted<WH6663>?
"Shall your boasts<WH907> silence<WH2790> men<WH4962>? And shall you scoff<WH3932> and none<WH369> rebuke<WH3637>?
"For you have said,<WH559> 'My teaching<WH3948> is pure,<WH2134> And I am<WH1961> innocent<WH1249> in your eyes.<WH5869>'
"But would<WH4310> <WH5414> that God<WH433> might speak,<WH1696> And open<WH6605> His lips<WH8193> against<WH5973> you,

And show<WH5046> you the secrets<WH8587> of wisdom!<WH2451> For sound<WH8454> wisdom<WH8454> has two<WH3718> sides.<WH3718> Know<WH3045> then that God<WH433> forgets<WH5382> a part of your iniquity.<WH5771>
"Can you discover<WH4672> the depths<WH2714> of God<WH433>? Can you discover<WH4672> the limits<WH8503> of the Almighty<WH7706>?
"[They are] high<WH1363> as the heavens,<WH8064> what<WH4100> can you do<WH6466>? Deeper<WH6013> than<WH4480> Sheol,<WH7585> what<WH4100> can you know<WH3045>?
"Its measure<WH4055> is longer<WH752> than<WH4480> the earth,<WH776> And broader<WH7342> than<WH4480> the sea.<WH3220>
"If<WH518> He passes<WH2498> by or shuts<WH5462> up, Or calls<WH6950> an assembly,<WH6950> who<WH4310> can restrain<WH7725> Him?
"For He knows<WH3045> false<WH7723> men,<WH4962> And He sees<WH7200> iniquity<WH205> without<WH3808> investigating.<WH995>
"And an idiot<WH376> <WH5014> will become<WH3823> intelligent<WH3823> When the foal<WH5895> of a wild<WH6501> donkey<WH6501> is born<WH3205> a man.<WH120>
"If<WH518> you would direct<WH3559> your heart<WH3820> right,<WH3559> And spread<WH6566> out your hand<WH3709> to Him;
If<WH518> iniquity<WH205> is in your hand,<WH3027> put<WH7368> it far<WH7368> away,<WH7368> And do not let wickedness<WH9390> dwell<WH7931> in your tents.<WH168>
"Then,<WH227> indeed,<WH3588> you could lift<WH5375> up your face<WH6440> without<WH4480> [moral] defect,<WH9249> And you would be steadfast<WH3332> and not fear.<WH3372>
"For you would forget<WH7911> [your] trouble,<WH5999> As waters<WH4325> that have passed<WH5674> by, you would remember<WH2142> [it.]
"And your life<WH2465> would be brighter<WH6965> than<WH4480> noonday;<WH6672> Darkness<WH9646> would be like the morning.<WH1242>
"Then you would trust,<WH982> because<WH3588> there<WH3426> is hope;<WH8615> And you would look<WH2658> around<WH2658> and rest<WH7901> securely.<WH983>
"You would lie<WH7257> down<WH7257> and none<WH369> would disturb<WH2729> [you,] And many<WH7227> would entreat<WH9134> your favor.<WH6440>
"But the eyes<WH5869> of the wicked<WH7563> will fail,<WH3615> And there will be no escape<WH6> for them; And their hope<WH4498> is to breathe<WH8615> their last.<WH4646>"
